title: EastEnders spoilers: Jay vows shocking revenge on his dad’s killer Terry Bates
text:
Jay Brown (Jamie Borthwick) got the shock of his life during tonight’s episode of EastEnders as he learned that Terry Bates — aka the man who killed his dad Jase Dyer (Stephen Lord) — had died, and that Coker and Mitchell would be conducting his funeral service.

Callum (Tony Clay) informed Jay that Coker and Mitchell was set to conduct a huge funeral, and thus they headed to the funeral parlour to sort out the arrangements for the impending service.

However, as Callum explained a few more of the details, the penny dropped for Jay, and he headed into the viewing room to check if his suspicions were correct. They were — and Jay was devastated to learn that the dead body was none other than Terry Bates.

It wasn’t just the fact that Coker and Mitchell were conducting his father’s killer’s funeral that annoyed Jay, but also the fact that Terry was being hailed as something of a hero — as over 200 people were expected to attend the event.

With a new rage on display, Jay told Callum to leave him alone, but Callum rang Ben (Max Bowden) to help him deal with the situation. Ben took over things at Coker’s, and informed Terry’s widow that the establishment would no longer be conducting the service, but — upon reflection — Jay decided that he would, in fact, help organise Terry’s funeral.

As the episode came to a close, Jay spoke to Terry’s body, berating him for everything he’d put him through, before informing him that all those in attendance at his funeral will know the truth.

Jay’s plotting revenge for sure, but will he carry out his threat?

Or will Lola (Danielle Harold), Callum or Ben be able to talk him out of it?

EastEnders continues Thursday 24thOctober at 7:30pm on BBC One.
